item.title: British tech entrepreneur Mike Lynch missing after yacht sinks off Sicily
item.dc:creator: Stefano Pitrelli, Kelsey Baker
item.description: Lynch, his daughter and four Americans were missing after the 183-foot luxury yacht Bayesian sank in a “violent storm.” Fifteen people were rescued; one crew member was found dead.

item.title: Hamas claims Tel Aviv attack as Blinken promotes cease-fire in Israel
item.dc:creator: John Hudson, Rachel Pannett, Annabelle Timsit, Loveday Morris
item.description: While the U.S. has said a deal could be concluded as early as this week, the explosion in Tel Aviv underscored the peril of the moment and the risk of escalation.

item.title: Russia closes in on eastern city despite Ukraine’s successes elsewhere
item.dc:creator: David Stern
item.description: Hopes that Ukraine’s incursion into Russia would relieve pressure on the eastern front are not being realized as Moscow’s forces approach Pokrovsk.

item.title: Chinese and Philippine ships collide at Sabina Shoal, a new flash point
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan, Lyric Li
item.description: The incident, the first time in decades that Beijing and Manila have clashed over the Sabina Shoal, may derail efforts to lower tensions in the South China Sea.

item.title: In Ukraine-controlled Sudzha, stranded Russian civilians question what’s next
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady, Tetiana Burianova
item.description: For Ukrainian forces on the ground, the offensive is seen less as a conquest for long-term annexation and more as a negotiating tactic.

item.title: Blinken arrives in Israel to push cease-fire deal amid doubts of success
item.dc:creator: John Hudson, Susannah George, Niha Masih, Annabelle Timsit, Hajar Harb, Jennifer Hassan
item.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken is in Israel for a trip focused on bridging the gaps between Israel and Hamas on a U.S.-sponsored cease-fire proposal.

item.title: Kremlin response to Kursk incursion shows how Putin freezes in a crisis
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: When Russian President Vladimir Putin’s authority is tested, his response often lacks quick, decisive action that lives up to his bellicose rhetoric.

item.title: Venezuelans stage global protests, seek recognition of election victory
item.dc:creator: Ana Herrero, Samantha Schmidt, María Luisa Paúl
item.description: In Venezuela and cities around the world, protesters carried vote tally receipts collected by the opposition showing that their candidate won more votes.

item.title: Gaza faces public health crisis with first confirmed case of polio
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The United Nations is now pushing for a pause in the fighting so it can coordinate two mass vaccination campaigns for more than 640,000 children.

item.title: X closes operations in Brazil, blames judge’s ‘censorship’ orders
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Peiser
item.description: The social media platform and owner Elon Musk have been feuding with Brazilian Justice Alexandre de Moraes for months.

item.title: Why Indonesia moved its capital to a jungle hundreds of miles away
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The new city, Nusantara, comes as Jakarta continues to sink at a record pace.

item.title: Israeli strikes in Gaza and Lebanon kill at least 25, officials say
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Mohamad El Chamaa, Suzan Haidamous, Frances Vinall, Victoria Bisset
item.description: Saturday’s bloodshed came after the United States and its allies expressed optimism over cease-fire negotiations to end the war in Gaza.

item.title: Jared Kushner wants to turn a wild stretch of Albania into a luxury resort
item.dc:creator: Chico Harlan, Michael Kranish, Isaac Stanley-Becker
item.description: Kushner’s use of foreign funds is again coming under scrutiny. Environmentalists fear his planned resort could destroy a delicate ecosystem.
